name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff of Riad Les Trois Palmiers understands the meaning of hospitality. From the moment you arrive until you leave the Riad, the staff accommodate your every need. My wife and I recently spent five nights at the Riad and couldn't have been more pleased with the service provided by the entire staff, especially Irsham and Mustafa. After having a flight cancelled due to a protest/strike by Royal Air Maroc, these gentlemen welcomed us back to the riad, without a reservation, and worked feverishly to help us resolve our issues and book a new flight for the next day. The Riad is the picture of relaxation and tranquility just a few blocks from the hustle and bustle of the souks. The rooms are comfortable and decorated in traditional Moroccan trim. The staff provide excellent recommendations about sights/ restaurants/events to enjoy. We will definitely return to Riad Les Trois Palmiers!
reviews.title: Hospitality beyond measure!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Besides a minority of guests, I see a real waste of superlative adjectives for this riad. And actually I selected it for the expectional wonders described here on tripadvisor, but after having seen the riad and lived there...well, I do not know whether these people is ingenuous, or has hearing and/or olfaction problems, or simply gets enchanted by some stylish piece of furniture. Probably most people tends to convince themselves that they had an incomparable vacation, in any case. I do not want ti be misunderstood: the riad is very good from many point of views, first of all the rich breakfast, the kindness of the staff, and the position, but absolutely out of standard (talking about quality/price ratio) from other points of view. Which ones? For instance, our bathroom emanated an intense sewer stink (and it was not a matter of the days I stayed there, since there was an electric perfume permanently plugged in the wall socket) that reached the sleeping area, the shower sink did not work properly, the blankets were never changed in 6 days (and were not exactly snow-white). But the most annoying for us was the noise made by the other guests after dinner: we never managed to close our eyes before 12.30 AM: laughs and screams of excited guests (probably those that then write excellent reviews) in one case lasted until 1 AM, without that nobody invited them to keep quiet (or to go back to Jemaa el Fna). And sometimes the show started again in the morning, when some guest decided to have breakfast in the court at 8 AM (not exactly the top, after having been waked up by the muezzin at 5.30 AM - but this is just normal). I understand that hearing other people is unavoidable in a structure like that of a riad, but exactly for this reason the owners should impose clear and simple rules to be absolutely respected by their guests. I was in similar structures and this did not happen, and it is not a matter of higher standard, but of good sense. After two nigths, I explained the situation to one of the guys of the staff, and he told me that the guests were invited to keep silence after 11 PM, but the night after the show continued. I thought I had reached a solution after having talked directly to one of the most screaming ladies, but evidently other guests joined that same day to make my effort vain. And the truth is that I was not advised of this "rule of silence" when I checked in, so I guess nobody is. Concerning the terrace, it is really very beautiful. But please people, do not exaggerate: other three friends of ours were in Marrakech in those same days in other riads in central position, so we could visit their places. They spent less than us and in their terraces they could even had a bath in a sort of Jacuzzi. In conclusion, I believe this is a nice and comfortable riad, but really overrated: if you want stay here at all costs, probably the best choice in terms of quality/price ratio is asking for the cheapest (and smallest) rooms on the roof, that are likely also those less affected by noise.
reviews.title: good, but nothing exceptional (as many people seem to believe)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I just returned from a 5 day stay at the Riad Les Trois Palmiers and highly recommend it. From the moment we were picked up at the airport until our departure we have never felt more cared for by any hotel staff. The rooms are really nicely decorated and comfortable and the rooftop terrace was fantastic. Breakfast was terrific too - coffee, fresh orange juice, yogurt & special Moroccan breads - and we loved eating it up on the terrace.
reviews.title: Absolutely wonderful!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 4 nights in April 2011. Like a lot of riads, it is located down a dingy alleyway and all you see is a front door. However, through the door is a very smart, light and comfortable courtyard with three palm trees growing (hence the name...) as well as a (chilly) dunking pool. There are about 8 rooms. Ours was very comfortable and fitted out in Moroccan style. The staff are really delightful. Breakfast was served on the rooftop terrace. Well located about a 10 min walk from the main square.
reviews.title: A most enjoyable stay with friendly helpful staff

reviews.text: A beautiful Riad, surpasses all expectations. An aura of tranquility in the heart of the bustling Medina. Wonderful roof terrace with lots of nooks and cranies, loved the touch of having straw hats provided on each sun bed! Service was friendly an excellent, food wonderful, breakfast was a real treat with freshly squeezed orange juice and real coffee. Hicham's hand drawn map and directions were so useful, don't know what we'd have done without them as Riad is down a maze of dark, narrow unmarked alley ways and there is no sign. Hicham organised a trip for my daughter and myself to the mountains in the Riad's own car with their own driver, excellent day out, good to get away from the hustle and bustle. This was excellent value. I would recommend this Riad to anyone who appreciates the finer things in life.
reviews.title: A Haven of Tranquility

reviews.text: I only found out I was off to Marrakech a week before I was going so had no time to do my usual research of somewhere to stay. So a surprise trip, the Riad had been chosen and I wasn’t disappointed. Right from the start the staff were outstanding. My bag had been left at Gatwick, but Pat, the Riad owner, was soon on the case and although he couldn’t make it get to Morocco any quicker, he made a call to a guy he knew at Air Maroc, which meant that my details were taken quickly and we could all get to the Riad.
reviews.title: Genuine friendliness and hospitality... you can't buy that sort of service

reviews.text: We approached the Riad down winding alleyways that we wondered how we would get out of (Left Left Right and a hand drawn map from Hicham!!), stopping off for a look in the local bakery on the way, and finally being welcomed by staff with sweets and Moroccan tea. No time to waste, Pat showed us around his lovingly restored Riad, with photo’s on the wall, traditional furniture and descriptions of the painstaking, creative detail of the making of the mosaic in the Palm filled courtyard behind the plunge pool.
reviews.title: Perfect Hotel, faultless in every way!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were taken into each room, but one had a young Muslim couple in there, which I felt shouldn’t be disturbed. But Pat ushered us in, only to my utter surprise and amazement, to find that this couple were my friends!! My partner had been arranging this trip for seven months and Pat and his staff made sure that they added to the surprise: they had acquired some traditional Muslim dress for my friends to dress up in!
reviews.title: Great location, very hospitable staff

reviews.text: We then toured the three flights of stairs with rooms off the inner courtyard as Pat led us each to our rooms. They were all beautiful, with nice touches of fruit, flowers and petals scattered on the bed as well as wall hangings, artefacts and rugs and amazing bathrooms. They had also allowed my friends in to decorate the room with birthday paraphernalia. And so it went on….
reviews.title: Beautiful Riad and Fantastic Hospitality

reviews.text: We had the whole Riad to ourselves and we were told to treat it as our home, which the thirteen of us did. Breakfast was served on the terrace and each day we had fresh bread from the local bakery, yoghurt, honey, jams, fruit, cheese, a variety of teas and coffee, and each day something different such as pancakes, donuts and crumpets.
reviews.title: Magical

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: ok.first of all very delighted with choice of riad.clean and tidy,staff amazing,mustafa and ishmel were fantastic,Mustafa if he was any more laid back he would never get up,hahhaha which was a far cry from my place of work which is intense and uninviting,food was brilliant and rooms were clean and tidy.location was spot on.breakfast on the terrace amazing everyday,generally a great experiance in the bizzare world of marrakesh.food in the riad was spot on lovely tagines and great service and cous cous.we will be back with family within 2 years.well done team.and the drives who took us to and from the airport.loved every minute of our stay.thanks,great time.never forgotten.10/10
reviews.title: great choice with fantastic service and food.

reviews.text: We came here to celebrate my partners 40th birthday and stayed in Les Trios Palmiers for 5 nights. There were 13 in total in our party and we were made to feel very welcome indeed. Pat the owner came to the airport to collect some of the party and gave us some info about Marrakech as we headed to the riad which made us feel welcomed and relaxed.
reviews.title: A great 5 days spent in a quality riad

reviews.text: The riad is located off a busy thorough-fare and down a couple of shabby looking alleyways which you get used to very quickly. Things suddenly change however once you get through the entrance door of the riad. You enter an ornate courtyard which has a small pool to one side and traditional seating areas in the open and in the smaller rooms to each side. A feeling of tranquillity descends once inside. The riad consists of 3 levels with an open terrace on the top floor (there is no roof). The first floor is where most of the rooms are with an additional two on the top and another one on the ground floor. The open terrace on the top is where we all took breakfast everyday as a group but I imagine this could be taken in the ground floor courtyard if requested. Breakfast was a continental affair with orange juice, tea (English & Moroccan), coffee, pastries, yoghurt and fresh fruit. The bread rolls were from the bakery down the nearby alley – very fresh.
reviews.title: Blown away...

reviews.text: There are also several sun beds on the roof terrace area and for those serious sun worshipers there was a final mini roof terrace right at the very top of the building up some steep wooden steps.
reviews.title: An absolute gem of a Riad - amazing location and staff - book it!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Detail is everything here and you see it in all aspects of the renovation. From mosaic tiles to authentic fixtures and fittings, doors, windows and ornate furnishings - lots of things have been meticulously thought about. Its not only the detail of the building that’s been thought about, attention to guests needs seems to be the ethos of this establishment.
reviews.title: Fantastic riad, real luxury, with a dissapointment in the end

reviews.text: This riad was what made our first visit to Marrakech so special. We couldn't have asked for a warmer welcome or to be better looked after. The place itself is lovely, location perfect for diving straight into the souks, and the food is excellent. Definitely have dinner here at least one night (if not every night) - it was our best meal of the trip. You can always try lunch in lots of other places if you like eating out.
reviews.title: Special
Charming warm accommodation
reviews.text: Can't recommend this place highly enough - don't look anywhere else - book this one!

We recently spent 3 delightful nights in Riad Les Trois Palmiers. The riad's owner, Patrick, was travelling, but Hicham and Moustafa made our visit perfect. Their welcome and service were extraordinary. The decor at the riad is beautiful. Our room was spacious and lovely and there was a wonderful bright patio area right outside, where afternoon tea or coffee and pastry were regularly on offer.
reviews.title: The best place I have ever stayed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We ate all three of our dinners at the riad. The meals were delicious and served graciously. The hotel is a haven away from the manic fever of Place Jamaa El Fna.
reviews.title: An amazing break in a wonderful Riad in a great location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We met Patrick on the last morning of our visit and he was a welcoming as his staff. In sum, the riad was an important part of why we loved Marrakesh.
reviews.title: Nice People

aka: Riad Les Trois Palmiers Hotel Marrakech
description: his sumptuous and spacious traditional Riad is located in the heart of the Medina, in one of the most sought after area of the Marrakech, less than 10 minutes walk from the famous Djeemaa El Fna Square, the souks and other places of interest.This vast and elegant Riad has been completely renovated by its owners in the pure respect of Moroccan craft, combining luxury, comfort, authenticity and charm. A true cultural and exotic journey through time and history.The Riad is offered in exclusivity in either 5/7 or 12 bedrooms and can comfortably accommodate up to 26 guests. A perfect venue for the family reunion, a large celebration or any other festive events.Modern and tastefully decorated with a touch of oriental’s, each bedrooms has quality beddings, safety deposit box, air-conditioning and en-suite bathrooms.
